2020-06-24.summary: The latest news on cannabis, hemp, CBD, psychedelics, and other green themes, now in Benzinga in Spanish, via El Planteo. How THCX and MJ Marijuana ETFs Pay Dividends in a Bajada Market By Javier Hasse. Last week, two of the top cannabis-focused ETFs, the ETFMG Alternative Harvest ETF (NYSE: MJ) and the Cannabis ETF (NYSE: THCX), announced they would distribute dividends. THCX declared a dividend of approximately 25 cents per share, to be paid on June 23 to shareholders of record at the close of business on June 22. With this distribution, THCX's dividend payment to date amounts to approximately 67 cents per share. MJ, for its part, paid a dividend of 28 cents per share on June 18 to shareholders of record as of the close of June 16. With this latest payment, the fund hopes to provide its shareholders with an annualized return of 8.17% - 7.42% after deducting MJ's 0.75% expense ratio.

2020-05-23.summary: The latest news on cannabis, hemp, CBD, psychedelics, and other green themes, now in Benzinga in Spanish, via El Planteo. Why Cannabis Stocks Are On The Rise: The Coronavirus Confusion Cannabis stocks have seen sharp increases since Thursday morning. In fact, all the major ETFs traded in the US, the ETFMG Alternative Harvest ETF (NYSE: MJ), the AdvisorShares Pure Cannabis ETF (NYSE: YOLO), the Cannabis ETF (NYSE: THCX), and the Amplify Seymour ETF Cannabis (NYSE: CNBS) reported double-digit gains. Interestingly, the main driver of this rise was an article published by the New York Post on Thursday, presenting information that had been released days before - with media such as Benzinga and El Planteo reporting on the subject since the previous week. According to a study by researchers at the University of Lethbridge in Alberta, Canada, and published in the Preprints journal. The study, which has not yet been reviewed and validated by other scientists, suggests that certain cannabis strains could help block the gateways of ACE2, which is the coronavirus used to enter the human body.

2020-04-27.summary: The latest news on cannabis, hemp, CBD, psychedelics, and other green themes, now on Benzinga in Spanish, via El Planteo. Why Cannabis Stocks Are Rising Today: Tilray, Canopy Growth, Aurora, Curaleaf and More Big cannabis companies are having a great Monday, with major stocks on the rise. Some even saw double digit gains in the morning. 2020-04-15.summary: Difficult market conditions, lack of access to credit, and growing financial pressures will cause the bankruptcy rate for cannabis stocks to soar with HEXO Corp. (TSX:HEXO)(NYSE:HEXO) being particularly vulnerable. The post Bankruptcies Ahead for Troubled Cannabis Stocks: Is HEXO (TSX:HEXO) Next? appeared first on The Motley Fool Canada .

2020-04-13.summary: The latest news on cannabis, hemp, CBD, psychedelics, and other green themes, now on Benzinga in Spanish, via El Planteo. Cannabis and News of the Week: Charlotte Figi's Death, Epidiolex's Category Change, Rising Actions and More Although last week had only 4 business days, it brought us a lot of news for the community and the cannabis industry. We must start with a deeply sad event: the death of Charlotte Figi, 13, from COVID-19. Charlotte had become the face of the marijuana legalization movement after the Colorado-growing Stanley brothers developed a high-CBD, low-THC marijuana strain to help the girl's parents. to treat his Dravet syndrome, a rather atypical form of epilepsy. In a heartbreaking post, the Stanley brothers described Charlotte's bravery: "Charlotte was three meters tall and carried the weight of the world on her shoulders." But apparently her activism was not in vain, as just hours after Charlotte's death we learned that the DEA had changed the category of the drug Epidiolex, from GW Pharamceuticals (NASDAQ: GWPH), to which it was no longer assigned. considered "dangerous and without therapeutic potential." This cannabinoid drug is used to treat Lennox-Gastaut syndrome and Dravet syndrome.

2020-04-01.summary: Hexo (TSE:HEXO) reported its second-quarter earnings on March 30. For the quarter, the company missed analysts' revenue expectations marginally.

2020-03-31.summary: Consumer packaged goods company HEXO Corp. (TSX: HEXO) (NYSE: HEXO ) released its second-quarter financial results Monday, posting net revenue of CA$17 million ($12.01 million), a 17% quarter-over-quarter increase. The company reported a quarterly net loss of CA$298.2 million versus a loss of CA$4.3 million in the same quarter of 2019. The HEXO Analysts Cantor Fitzgerald's Pablo Zuanic maintained an Underweight rating on Hexo with a price target of CA$0.72 (51 cents). BofA Securities’ Christopher Carey resumed an Underperform rating on the stock with a CA$1 price objective. Cantor Sees Important Issue In Hexo’s Lack Of Improvement In Cash Burn The most important factors in Hexo's second-quarter report were: no improvement in cash burn, lower gross profit per gram and worsening operating cash flow/sales ratios, Zuanic said in a Monday note. Considering that the company’s operating cash flow worsened while its adjusted EBITDA figures improved, the analyst suggested that adjusted EBITDA shouldn’t be used to …

2020-03-30.summary: Hexo (HEXO) earnings for the Canadian cannabis company's fiscal second quarter of 2020 have HEXO stock taking a beating on Monday.

Consumer packaged goods company HEXO Corp. (TSX:HEXO) (NYSE: HEXO ) disclosed Monday its second quarter financial results. The cannabis-focused company generated CA$17 million ($12.01 million) in net revenue. That's up by 17% from CA$14.5 million in the previous quarter. HEXO also posted a total net loss of CA$298.2 million, which compares to a loss of CA$4.3 million in the same period of 2019 and to a loss of CA$60 million in the first quarter of 2019. Its adjusted EBITDA was also a loss of CA$10.3 million, compared to a loss of CA$19.4 million in the first quarter of fiscal 2020. At the end of … Full story available on Benzinga.com

HEXO Corp.’s (TSX: HEXO; NYSE: HEXO) loss expanded in the second quarter of 2020, hurt by significant impairment charges. Hexo posted a loss of C$298 million compared to C$4 million in the second quarter of 2019. Net revenue rose 27% annually to $17 million. 2020-03-17.summary: At the World Health Organization media briefing held March 11, COVID-19 was officially declared a pandemic. “This is not just a public health crisis, it is a crisis that will touch every sector,” said Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO director-general, stated. “So every sector and every individual must be involved in the fight.” Some cannabis companies have already been affected. Benzinga is covering every angle of how the coronavirus affects the financial world. For daily updates, sign up for our daily coronavirus newsletter .
